definition: to take an inventory of stock/to clear out one's stock
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
to make an inventory of warehouses

sentences.english: The company will make an inventory of the warehouse this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午公司要清仓盘点货物。

sentences.english: This shopping mall is having a big clearance sale.
sentences.chinese: 这家购物商场正进行清仓大拍卖勾当。

sentences.english: Foreign - funded enterprises over the past few days have been close-out cigarettes on the deal.
sentences.chinese: 连日来外资企业已纷纷对香烟进行清仓处理。

sentences.english: Because we're clearing out our stock right now.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们现在正在清仓。

sentences.english: We will have a bargain sale today.
A couple of companies are having one-day clearance sales today.
sentences.chinese: 有两个公司今天有一天的清仓大减价。

sentences.english: Dump clearance goods at low price.
Many stores are having clearance sales to get rid of goods damaged during typhoon Nari.
sentences.chinese: 许多商家清仓大拍卖来清掉纳莉台风期间受损的商品。

sentences.english: Then each subset is flushed to the corresponding database.
sentences.chinese: 然后每个子集被清仓到对应的数据库。

sentences.english: We have a clearance sale today.
We are offering a big clear on sale,all the goods are thirty persent off.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在举行清仓大拍卖，所有商品一律七折出售。

sentences.english: We are offering a big clear on sale, all the goods are thirty persent off.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在举行清仓大拍卖，所有商品一律七折出售。

sentences.english: Stock to be cleared is unrivaled in both variety and quality.
sentences.chinese: 清仓商品无论种类还是质量都无可挑剔。

sentences.english: For example, Bed, Bath &Beyond has a clearance section where you can find all kinds of wonderful household items for a fraction of the original cost.
sentences.chinese: 例如，你可以在清仓甩卖点看到各类超值的卫浴寝具。

sentences.english: I bought this top for a very cheap price at a clearance sale.
sentences.chinese: 我是在清仓大甩卖时以相当便宜的价钱买了这件上衣。

sentences.english: Isabel's is having a clearance sale, and today is the last day.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔正在清仓大拍卖，今天是最后一天。

definition: to sell/to reach (a price in an auction)
to mark down (the price of goods)/to sell off cheap
to take money or valuables out of storage/to recover/to ship goods/to extract (chemicals from solution)
to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
